intro: Acorellus laevigatus subsp. distachyos, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acorellus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its small, white to greenish flowers are usually clustered in umbrella-like structures, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrower leaves and shorter peduncles compared to other members of the species.
